tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE customers (customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(50), address VARCHAR(100));
CREATE TABLE water_usage (usage_id INT PRIMARY KEY, customer_id INT, usage_date DATE, gallons_used INT);

CREATE TABLE water_meters (
  meter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  meter_type VARCHAR(20),
  install_date DATE,
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE water_usage (
  usage_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  meter_id INT,
  usage_date DATE,
  gallons_used FLOAT,
  FOREIGN KEY (meter_id) REFERENCES water_meters(meter_id)
);

CREATE TABLE UsageLogs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT,
    usage_date DATE,
    usage_amount INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (meter_id) REFERENCES WaterMeters(meter_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Billing (
    bill_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    log_id INT,
    amount_due DECIMAL(10,2),
    paid_status BOOLEAN,
    FOREIGN KEY (log_id) REFERENCES UsageLogs(log_id)
);

CREATE TABLE water_meters (
    meter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT NOT NULL,
    meter_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    meter_location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE water_usage (
    usage_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT NOT NULL,
    usage_date DATE NOT NULL,
    usage_amount FLOAT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (meter_id) REFERENCES water_meters(meter_id)
);

CREATE TABLE billing_records (
    billing_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT NOT NULL,
    billing_date DATE NOT NULL,
    amount_due FLOAT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(customer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE payment_records (
    payment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    billing_id INT NOT NULL,
    payment_date DATE NOT NULL,
    payment_amount FLOAT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (billing_id) REFERENCES billing_records(billing_id)
);
